ranked_diseases.explanation: This disease is directly associated with nystagmus, very low visual acuity, and eye poking, matching all the phenotypic features of the patient.
Other subtypes of Leber congenital amaurosis may present with similar visual impairments but may also include varied other symptoms. Since they are related, they are ranked next.
This condition can cause visual impairment and may have overlapping features such as hypermetropia and nystagmus, although other specific symptoms like retinal changes would be expected.
Bardet-Biedl syndrome can manifest with visual impairment and nystagmus, but it additionally includes multi-systemic features, making it a less fitting diagnosis compared to the others.
